title: dolphriends
author: dolphriends
content: Hello friendsDoes anyone know the face value difference in btc of the pre fork satori roll vs. post folk.Appreciate the helpDolphin

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: IIRC, Satori post fork recently sold in an auction @0.0068BTC on one of MJ auction recently https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5468242.msg62936055#msg62936055. Pre fork Satori usually sell a little bit higher due to whatever reason I don’t since shitcoins it contain is almost worthless.BTW they have same face value since fork coins included on prefork is just a peanuts while both tokens have same appearance and loaded with same amount of Bitcoin.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Also, pretty sure less post-fork sartoris exist than pre-fork. I'm not really sure what the difference is anymore in price unfortunately.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: The inherent value of the pre fork lies in the earlier the coin the more sought after it is. The value isnt necessarily in the forks. The closer you get to coin 00001 the more value you coins have. There is a quest to get the lowest satori and value increases the lower you get.

comments.author: Lesbian Cow
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on October 29, 2023, 08:45:02 PMThe inherent value of the pre fork lies in the earlier the coin the more sought after it is. The value isnt necessarily in the forks. The closer you get to coin 00001 the more value you coins have. There is a quest to get the lowest satori and value increases the lower you get.I am not sure this is true, except with very low serial numbers.  Personally, I prefer the post fork as the mintage numbers are significantly lower.In my recent sales of both pre and post fork I priced them the same.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: Lesbian Cow on October 30, 2023, 02:17:05 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on October 29, 2023, 08:45:02 PMThe inherent value of the pre fork lies in the earlier the coin the more sought after it is. The value isnt necessarily in the forks. The closer you get to coin 00001 the more value you coins have. There is a quest to get the lowest satori and value increases the lower you get.I am not sure this is true, except with very low serial numbers.  Personally, I prefer the post fork as the mintage numbers are significantly lower.In my recent sales of both pre and post fork I priced them the same. Thats great news LC, ill be watching for any satori's  you sell. Sounds like your the person to buy them from. I agree that there wouldnt be much of a price difference from a coin numbered 30000 to coin numbered 34000. Significant premiums kick in when you start talking 17000, 12000, 9000. I remember seeing a 7000 coin sell pretty high off ebay.

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: I have to say...I prefer the prefork Satori chips anyway.....they do have the shit coins..yes but they were also loaded BEFORE a Bitcoin historical forking event...making them harder to replicate ever. That kind of loading can never be replicated.
